    • 盧 [ lú ] cottage, hut; black; surname
heisig_chinese_memo: The louvre has extra fire safety but feels like a stove because they also have no air conditioning as part of the fire safety - no electronics allowed.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: This stove is equipped with a fire-proof door. On the hanzi you can see somewhat pictographically the fire-proof door keeping the fire behind, and nothing comes under the door primitive, where you would have expected to see another primitive.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " fire " to " Lu " sound, the original meaning is a fire appliance or device for cooking, smelting, heating, etc. "Han Feizi·Nei Chu said the next": "Fon the burning furnace, the charcoal fire will be red."

" Furnace " can refer to incense burner and smoker. Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xiaowei's "Poem of Complaint": "The candle avoids the shadow in the window, the incense goes back to the stove and smokes."

" Furnace " can also be used as a quantifier. Thirty Seven of Tang Luyan's "Seven Words": "A furnace of sacred medicine is made, and the five clouds return clearly."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " fire " and " Lu ", the original meaning is a fire appliance or device for cooking, smelting, heating, etc.
humanum_full_description:
從「火」，「盧」聲，本義為供烹飪、冶煉、取暖等用的盛火器具或裝置。《韓非子‧內儲說下》：「奉熾爐，炭火盡亦紅。」

　　「爐」可指香爐、熏爐。南朝梁劉孝威〈怨詩〉：「燭避窗中影，香迴爐上煙。」

　　「爐」還可用作量詞。唐呂岩〈七言〉之三七：「煉出一爐神聖藥，五雲歸去路分明。」
humanum_short_description: 從「火」，「盧」聲，本義為供烹飪、冶煉、取暖等用的盛火器具或裝置。

爐火 [ lú huǒ ]: the fire of a stove
(Simplified: 炉)
Ideographic: A fire 火 in one's home 盧
HSK: 6
Chinese: The louvre has extra fire safety but feels like a stove because they also have no air conditioning as part of the fire safety - no electronics allowed.
Meaning: stove
Hanzi: 炉
Story: This stove is equipped with a fire-proof door. On the hanzi you can see somewhat pictographically the fire-proof door keeping the fire behind, and nothing comes under the door primitive, where you would have expected to see another primitive.
Kind: traditional
從「 火 」，「 盧 」聲，本義為供烹飪、冶煉、取暖等用的盛火器具或裝置。《韓非子‧內儲說下》：「奉熾爐，炭火盡亦紅。」 「 爐 」可指香爐、熏爐。南朝梁劉孝威〈怨詩〉：「燭避窗中影，香迴爐上煙。」 「 爐 」還可用作量詞。唐呂岩〈七言〉之三七：「煉出一爐神聖藥，五雲歸去路分明。」
From " fire" to " Lu" sound, the original meaning is a fire appliance or device for cooking, smelting, heating, etc. "Han Feizi·Nei Chu said the next": "Fon the burning furnace, the charcoal fire will be red." " Furnace" can refer to incense burner and smoker. Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xiaowei's "Poem of Complaint": "The candle avoids the shadow in the window, the incense goes back to the stove and smokes." " Furnace" can also be used as a quantifier. Thirty Seven of Tang Luyan's "Seven Words": "A furnace of sacred medicine is made, and the five clouds return clearly."

爐字的基本解释

爐
lú
见“炉”。

爐字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lú］
［《廣韻》落胡切，平模，來。］
“炉1”的繁体字。亦作“鹵2”。
(1)供烹饪、冶炼、取暖等用的盛火器具或装置。
(2)指香炉；熏炉。
(3)用同“壚”。古时酒店前放置酒坛的炉形土墩。
(4)煮。
(5)量词。

爐字的康熙字典解释

【巳集中】【火字部】　爐； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页686第31
【玉篇】洛乎切，音盧。火爐也。【范致能詩】何如田舍火爐頭。

爐字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
爐字的起名意思

暂无。

furnace
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [lú]
["Guangyun" Luo Huqie, flat model, come. ]
Traditional characters for "炉1". Also known as "halogen 2".
(1) Fire appliances or devices for cooking, smelting, heating, etc.
(2) Refers to the incense burner; the smoker.
(3) Use the same as "垆". The furnace-shaped mound where the wine jar was placed in front of the hotel in ancient times.
(4) Boil.
(5) Quantifiers.
